author: Aloysius Xavier Lopez
text:
With contractors attributing drop in quality of roads that are being relaid to shortage in bitumen, Greater Chennai Corporation has started initiatives to fix the problem. As contractors pointed to bitumen shortage in the IOC, HPCL and BPCL, Greater Chennai Corporation recently conducted an emergency meeting with suppliers.

Some contractors claimed that they also ended up procuring bitumen of substandard quality due to shortage. During previous instances of sample examination, the Corporation had penalised contractors who had been found to reduce the quantity of bitumen. The civic body has stringent norms for road relaying.

Corporation officials said they feared that new roads that contained lesser quantity of bitumen could fall apart in a few months.

The civic body gave the companies the requirement schedule of bitumen.

“Considering the extensive damages caused by floods to the roads, the main supplier, IOCL, and the other two suppliers have agreed to enhance their production capacity so that the supply is adequate,” said an official of Chennai Corporation.

Out of the production quantity of 2,200 tonnes, the IOCL has agreed to apportion bitumen to Greater Chennai Corporation on a priority basis.
title: Quality of roads takes a hit
